Late in the evening, the wind blew hard around the little house. The sound of the wind is
ewlinelike someone crying. It made the old woman nervous. She had not been getting much sleep
ewlinelately, but with the wind making the spooky noise, she didn't know what else to do but lie
ewlinedown and try to rest a little.
ewline
ewlineOnce she lay down to try to sleep, many memories of her life in the little house kept her
ewlinemind busy. She still was having trouble falling asleep. She remembered being a little girl
ewlineand her dad putting the finishing touches on the house. Her mom loved the big kitchen, and
ewlineshe and her younger sister had their own room in the back.
ewline
ewlineIt was in this, her old bedroom, that she was trying to sleep. The crying sound got
ewlinelouder. It didn't seem like it was outside. It sounded like it was coming from the other
ewlineside of the bed. When she turned and looked, she saw her younger sister. She still looked
ewlinefive years old. The old woman couldn't remember her any other way, as she had died from a
ewlinesickness at age five.
ewline
ewline"What's wrong?" she asked her sister. "I miss you. I am so lonely," answered the little
ewlinegirl, who was so thin you could see through her. The old lady closed her eyes and reached
ewlinefor her sister. That is how they found her the next day, holding her pillow and smiling.
ewline
ewline"She died in her sleep." "It is best that way."
